title: Multigraded strong Lefschetz property for balanced simplicial complexes
abstract:
Generalizing the strong Lefschetz property for an $\mathbb{N}$-graded
algebra, we introduce the multigraded strong Lefschetz property for an
$\mathbb{N}^m$-graded algebra. We show that, for $\bm{a} \in \mathbb{N}^m_+$,
the generic $\mathbb{N}^m$-graded Artinian reduction of the Stanley-Reisner
ring of an $\bm{a}$-balanced homology sphere over a field of characteristic $2$
satisfies the multigraded strong Lefschetz property. A corollary is the
inequality $h_{\bm{b}} \leq h_{\bm{c}}$ for $\bm{b} \leq \bm{c} \leq
\bm{a}-\bm{b}$ among the flag $h$-numbers of an $\bm{a}$-balanced simplicial
sphere. This can be seen as a common generalization of the unimodality of the
$h$-vector of a simplicial sphere by Adiprasito and the balanced generalized
lower bound inequality by Juhnke-Kubitzke and Murai. We further generalize
these results to $\bm{a}$-balanced homology manifolds and $\bm{a}$-balanced
simplicial cycles over a field of characteristic $2$.
